Articles.Content:
Greetings, gravity defying enthusiasts! I have been playing KSP for quite a while, having dabbled with it since 0.23, and playing quite a bit since 1.0. I visit the forums at least once a day, having learned a lot from the tutorial section, as well as gaining a lot of inspiration from the craft section. Here is my first submission to the forums, a proof of concept crew shuttle. I hope I can contribute a bit to this great project. 

![SwWfPu3.jpg](http://imgur.com/SwWfPu3.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-04T16:42:38Z" title="08/04/2015 04:42  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 4, 2015</time> by Claw**

Ah wow. That's roughly when I started KSP also. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Glad to hear you signed on after visiting for so long. Looking forward to seeing more of your designs. (I fixed your link.)

Welcome to the forums! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Cheers,

-Claw

Hello! ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) It was about time to do some serious disassem... ... constr... errm... ahhh... you know what we are doing here.

That... thing, ... yepp.

Happy landings!
Welcome! Aren't the offset and rotate tools making it much easier to build shuttles than in .23?
Welcome aboard! I'm always looking do defeat my arch-nemesis, Gravity.
